meanings.definition: Satisfying or fulfilling a desire or need.
meanings.sent1: The delicious meal was truly satiating for the hungry guests.
meanings.sent2: After a long day's work, a good night's sleep can be very satiating.
meanings.sent3: The satiating aroma of freshly baked cookies filled the entire house.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter had a satiating effect on everyone's mood, instantly lifting their spirits.
meanings.sent5: The sun setting over the ocean created a satiating view that calmed the soul.

meanings.definition: Providing a feeling of fullness or satisfaction.
meanings.sent1: The hearty stew was so satiating that no one had room for dessert.
meanings.sent2: A warm cup of cocoa can be quite satiating on a cold winter evening.
meanings.sent3: The satiating hug from her friend made her feel truly loved and cared for.
meanings.sent4: The satiating silence of the library allowed her to focus intently on her studies.
meanings.sent5: The satiating feeling of accomplishment washed over her as she completed the marathon.

meanings.sent1: The juicy watermelon was a satiating treat on a hot summer day.
meanings.sent2: A cold glass of lemonade can be incredibly satiating after a long walk.
meanings.sent3: The satiating sound of sizzling bacon made his stomach growl in anticipation.
meanings.sent4: The satiating taste of the ripe berries made her forget all about her hunger.
meanings.sent5: The satiating coolness of the ice cream cone was a welcome relief on a scorching afternoon.
